item.title: Linden court residents, 20th October
item.description:
What is the council doing about the rat infested linden court? And the fact residents just dump stuff on the pavement for us- why are local residents having to endure this and absolutely nothing seems to change ?

item.title: Fly tip again at top of panfield road and white van again present who is the culprit,he dumps it early in morning as usual, 20th October
item.description:

item.title: Boxes flytipped, 20th October
item.description:
Hi! we're closed over the weekend and opened the door to find our fire escape blocked by various boxes, I've cleared a walkway but its still a safety hazard, please can you remove them, kind regards (no7 dean st just down from tesco)

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 91, Dean Street, London

item.title: Deteriorated Road Surface Constitutes Health & Safety Risk for Elderly, 20th October
item.description:
Road surface of the cul-de-sac at the SE end of Edmeston Close, marked in grey, has deteriorated significantly & is a safety risk to the elderly & infirm who have right of way to exit. Road is private, however, LBH need to act to ensure owners maintain it.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Edmeston Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 5 wheelie bins blocking pavement., 20th October
item.description:
For 5 plus months neighbours have blocked the pavement with their 5 wheelie bins. It's causing obstructions to passers by in wheelchairs, with prams etc. The cars end up being damaged because people can't get past. Also a fridge freezer in their front garden is an eyesore. It's been there months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thanet Road, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plumstead High Street, Plumstead, London

item.title: Rubbish left after flytip ‘cleared., 20th October
item.description:
The flytip that had been left for a month or more was finally cleared over a week ago but none of the residual rubbish and litter was cleared at the same time! This litter came from the flytipped bags being ripped open by foxes so when clearing a tip it is sense to ensure all surrounding little also collected. Some has stated blowing down Bloomfield Road and onto Plumstead common road. If clearing a flytip, please don’t only do half the job!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bloomfield Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
